thread.title: GREENCASTLE-ANTRIM ROUNDUP: Field hockey continues playoff push; volleyball, boys' soccer both fall
thread.title_full: GREENCASTLE-ANTRIM ROUNDUP: Field hockey continues playoff push; volleyball, boys' soccer both fall

title: GREENCASTLE-ANTRIM ROUNDUP: Field hockey continues playoff push; volleyball, boys' soccer both fall
text: GREENCASTLE-ANTRIM ROUNDUP: Field hockey continues playoff push; volleyball, boys' soccer both fall Comment   Writer Posted Oct. 19, 2015 at 11:15 AM Posted Oct. 19, 2015 at 11:15 AM FIELD HOCKEY Blue Devils edge Big Spring NEWVILLE — Greencastle-Antrim continued its push toward the postseason Saturday at Big Spring, edging the Bulldogs 1-0 in Mid-Penn Colonial Division action. Racheal Marconi scored the game’s only goal midway through the second half, finishing an assist from Lauren Cole. “The girls gave a great effort in a game we had to have,” G-A coach Becca Farson said. “Mackenzie Oberholzer (goalie) and our corner defenders were a huge reason we won. Offensively, we showed promise with solid passing and movement up both sides of the field.” Oberholzer made 13 saves to preserve the shutout. “We were able to withstand a flurry of corners from Big Spring late in the second half,” Farson said. With the win, the Blue Devils (9-7-1) climbed to 15th in the current District 3 power ratings, which will determine playoff qualifiers. In Class AA, the top-20 advance. G-A also won Saturday’s junior varsity contest, 1-0. Presley Stockslager scored the eventual game-winner for the Blue Devils. Greencastle concludes its regular season schedule today at Milton Hershey. GIRLS’ VOLLEYBALL Blue Devils fall to Hershey in five sets GREENCASTLE — Greencastle-Antrim came up short in another five-set thriller Saturday against visiting Hershey. Coming off a tough defeat to Waynesboro on Thursday, G-A established a 2-1 lead before Hershey rallied for the non-league victory. The Blue Devils (10-8) won the first set 25-23 before dropping the second 22-25. G-A then captured the third 25-20 prior to Hershey reeling off wins of 25-22 and 15-11. Sydney Shepherd paced Greencastle with 14 kills followed by seven from Keri Gearhart and six from both Sierra Wenger and Rachel Verhoef. Gabby Baughman registered 12 digs and four aces while Wenger contributed 11 digs in the back row. Chloe McKenzie returned at setter, distributing 23 assists. The Blue Devils make the lengthy trip to West Perry tomorrow before hosting James Buchanan on Thursday. BOYS’ SOCCER Carlisle deals G-A second straight loss CARLISLE — Greencastle-Antrim fell to Carlisle on Saturday, closing its regular season with a 4-2 non-league loss. Saturday marked the first time G-A (13-5) lost back-to-back games this fall. Brandon Stuhler and Kaleb Hurley scored for the Blue Devils. With the loss, Greencastle dropped to 17th in the current District 3 power ratings, as the top-20 teams will qualify for the playoffs. As champions of the Mid-Penn Colonial Division, the Blue Devils will be participating in the Mid-Penn Conference tournament, with the semifinals scheduled for Tuesday night. G-A is hosting the semifinal match, set to begin at 6:30 p.m. Page 2 of 2 - The outcome of tomorrow’s contest will not effect the Blue Devils’ power rating.   Writer
